introduction: The redis_mon node tool provides a method to test a redis cache with set/get key/values, where the test will timeout if it takes longer than 5 seconds to get a response.
-h: Provide the host with this flag e.g. node redis-mon -h 127.0.0.1
-p: The port to the redis server, e.g. -p 6379
-c: Command set or get, e.g. -c set or -c get
-k: The key to pair with given value/data, e.g., -k testKey
-d: Data/value to be paired with given key, e.g., -d testData
-t: Provide the timeout time in seconds following -t e.g. node redis-mon -t 5
